content.description: The base of the route is the crux.  There are no good foot holds and tricky handholds.  The route gets easier as you ascend.  The stone is very soft so I expect good handholds will break off.
content.protection: Top rope only.  There is a set of bolts. They are about 6' back from the face and about 4' apart.  Two cordelettes are needed to rig an anchor that extends down the face.
content.location: The route is dead center of the cliff and dead center of the two bolts.

content.description: This is a small climb on very soft sandstone.  It is in the shade.  In Jason Martin's Book Fun Climbs in Red Rock the area is described as a place the Boy Scouts rappel.
